risks: Need to test across different screen sizes to ensure fixed height works properly
May need to adjust mobile responsive breakpoints if text wrapping behavior changes
Should verify that the fixed height doesn't create excessive white space on smaller screens

detailed_analysis.problem_description: The hero section experiences Cumulative Layout Shift (CLS) when the typing animation cycles through phrases of varying lengths. The current min-height approach (6rem desktop, 4rem mobile) is insufficient to prevent layout shifts.
detailed_analysis.root_cause: The typing text container dynamically adjusts its height based on text content length, causing the entire page to bounce up and down when switching between short phrases like 'Engineering Lead' and long phrases like 'Machine Learning Researcher'.

proposed_solution.approach: Calculate and set a fixed height that accommodates the longest phrase across all screen sizes
proposed_solution.implementation: Update the .hero-title CSS rules to use a calculated fixed height instead of min-height
proposed_solution.testing_required: Verify layout stability across desktop, tablet, and mobile viewports

detailed_analysis.effort_estimate: 1-2 hours including testing across different screen sizes
detailed_analysis.business_impact: Improves user experience by eliminating distracting layout shifts, enhances perceived professionalism, and potentially improves Core Web Vitals (CLS) scores

issue_title: Bug: Hero section moves up and down when typing animation changes text length
